quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Happy Holidays, Dwight. But do not open it till Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're so pathetic.  How long did this take you? Three hours?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Five minutes actually.  I am a black belt in gift wrapping.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, no such thing.  They don't give out black belts for things that are stupid. [scoffs]  Well, I hope it was worth it, cause I'm gonna take it apart in about five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think it'll take you a little longer than that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really? If I can skin a mule deer in less than ten minutes, I ought to be able to cut my -- [sets briefcase on desk and sits in chair, desk and chair are made of paper, Dwight crashes to the floor]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Eh...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I'm sorry.  It's the largest one I have.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I will not be the big guy in the tiny hat. [Kevin is wearing the same hat]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: This is the first Christmas party I am throwing as head of the party planning committee.  The theme is "Nights in Morocco".  This isn't your grandmothers Christmas party.  Unless of course she's from Morocco, in which case it's very accurate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Phyllis, do I need this invite to get in to the party?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Awesome.  I think this is going to be the best Christmas party ever.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Angela. You're going to move this for the party right? It's not on theme.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's the nativity scene.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Alright. You can keep your camel, sheep, elephant and the north African king can stay.  Everything else goes in the drawer.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I am not going to judge Phyllis for desecrating Christmas.  There is one person who will though and Phyllis just stuffed him into a drawer.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I need you to get rid of the tree.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: But--

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, I don't think it's blackmail.  Angela just does what I ask her to do so I won't tell everyone that she's cheating on Andy with Dwight.  I think for it to be black mail, it would have to be a formal letter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ah. You brought in your doll collection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: These are not dolls, Jim.  These are commodities.  Same as gold or oil.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Every year I do research to determine which toy will be the most popular of the Christmas season.  This year it's a doll. Half girl, half unicorn.  Catchphrase: "My horn can pierce the sky".  Pathetic. I bought out every store in the area over the last couple of weeks.  And as lazy parents become desperate I will sell them for an enormous profit.  Isn't that right princess? [makes doll nod]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's the Christmas spirit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I am simply punishing those parents that would wait till the last minute to get their child a gift.  And such a genetically improbable one.  Look at that.  How does that happen?  King has sex with a unicorn?  Man with a horn has sex with a royal horse?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, hey, is that Princess Unicorn?  I thought they were all sold out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They are now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cool. [sings] My horn can pierce the sky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is equal parts scotch, absinthe, rum, gin, vermouth, triple sec, and two packs of Splenda. Call it a one of everything.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [drinks] Oh... my... GOD!!!  [laughs] Hit me again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright... One more time around the block.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I will grant you one wish.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I wish that you'd stop rubbing that lamp in that creepy way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Stupid.  Everyone knows to ask for a hundred more wishes. [Pam laughs] Dumb.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [sitting on floor playing the sitar] Hey, hey... Ange... check it out.  [sings] There's a place in France where the naked ladies dance. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Really Andy? It's Christmas and your singing about nudity and France.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [sings] There's a hole in the wall where the men can see it all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jim, Jim....

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is vodka and I mixed it with orange juice.  I call it an orange-vod-juice...ka.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, that is delicious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Can't believe no ones thought of that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [dancing drunkenly] Ahh yeah!!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [continuing to dance, lifting her shirt] Belly dancing!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.line: Thank you so much. My daughter is going to love this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, so glad I could help.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.line: You too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-ka-ching.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs] Oh, so this is what every day would be like if you hadn't left India.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Meredith's hair is on fire] Oh, oh, oh, oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We got a live one!  On fire!! [Dwight extinguishes Meredith]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I'm all right. I'm all right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: We're back on the 5th, should we just do it then?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can not do it then. Monthly dental appointment, soft teeth

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What about February 2nd?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ah... would you want to do it on Groundhogs day?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no. I celebrate privately.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why don't we just do it now? We'll do it quickly.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Now? It's our Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We'll do it quickly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well what if we can't do it quickly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [mimicking] What if we can't do it quickly? What if we cant do it--

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Do you know how to do an intervention?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, shut up. Here we go. Everybody gather up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: An intervention.  It's sort of hard to describe, but really its-- it's a coming together... it's a surprise party for people who are-- who have addictions.  And you get in their face and you scream at them and you make them feel really badly about themselves.  And then they stop.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It looks like we're going to be here for awhile, so why don't you make a little plate of hummus for everyone.  Little triangles of pita, toasted on both sides, fanned so you can easily can grab them.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don't--

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: And napkins... fanned.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, how do you feel?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: A little better. I threw up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uck... T.M.I.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Fire girl. [looks around] Too soon?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, you know what I thought we should do is have a quick intervention and then get back to the party.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael, we are only allowed to talk about Meredith's work performance. We can not ask her to stop drinking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am not asking her to stop drinking.  I am imploring her to quit being an alcoholic.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I'm not an alcoholic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, obviously you are. Okay, everybody who thinks that Meredith is an alcoholic please raise your hand. [everyone raises their hand]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Aye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The aye's have it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I don't care what everyone thinks.  I know I am not an alcoholic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright, well, let's look at this a little bit closer then shall we? [pulls a piece of paper out of his pocket]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: When I was in college I used to get wicked hammered. My nickname was puke.  I would chug a fifth of socos, sneak into a frat party, polish off a few people's empties, some brewskies, some Jell-O shots, do some body shots off myself, pass out, wake up the next morning, puke, rally, more soco, head to class.  Probably would have gotten expelled if I had let it affect my grades, but I aced all my courses.  They called me Ace.  It was totally awesome.  Got straight B's.  They called me Buzz.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Meredith, have you ever used alcohol to alter your mood or deliberately change your state of mind?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you sometimes have a drink to celebrate a special occasion or mark a holiday?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Obviously.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Have you ever under the influence of alcohol questioned the teachings of the Mormon church?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Where did you get this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I got it on a website, that's not important.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael, We should contact some experts.  You don't know what your doing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, you know what Toby?  One of my employees is undergoing a crisis and I wish for just once you would take my side on this.  I'm doing your job man.  Hey, are you texting?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, 'cause this is kind of a drag.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alcohol is a drag. Yes.  Here's what I'd like to do.  I'd like to go around the room and have us each express to Meredith how her alcoholism has affected us.  I'll begin.  This Christmas party is perhaps the best Christmas party I have ever been to, but then you got so drunk that we had to stop and do this.  That's how your drinking affected me.  Anybody else?  Another time when Meredith's drinking affected you?   Come on people.  If we don't say anything she's not going to get any better.  [Kevin raises his hand] Yes, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Well, Meredith, there was that one time you bought movie tickets and then you got too drunk to go, so you gave them to me.  And that was really cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's-- you didn't-- you weren't hurt by that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, you said affected by it.   Thanks again, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, no, that's not what we're going for.  Who has a problem with Meredith's drinking?  It has to bother you.  It bothers me. Right? How does it bother you?  Dwight, don't you have anything?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, I like Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Actually, I don't care for Meredith, but I don't believe in this kind of thing.  In the Schrute family we believe in a five fingered intervention. [holds up his fist] Awareness, education, control, acceptance and punching.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who is going to tell us the latest dirty joke?  Who is going to tell us what you watched on television last night?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I am fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Was John Belushi fine?  Was Bob Hope fine?  Hey-- come here.  If anything ever happened to you, I would be very angry at myself for not doing all that I could do.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I know I drink. I like to party

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want you to say I'm an alcoholic.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I am not an alcoholic!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You can say it as loudly as you want, but we're not going to believe you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I was waiting until later to hand out this years gifts from corporate. [holds up shot glass] I don't think they're appropriate anymore.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Please stop making me do these things.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, sorry, it's your job.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: But it's the season of mercy.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You never showed me mercy when you were in charge.  Why aren't you wearing the hairnet?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I lost it. [Phyllis glares at her until Angela pulls out the hairnet and puts it on]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Ok... nice.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I don't mind telling you that I have an addiction.  I do.  To porn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [amid groans from the rest of the office] Alright, no, no, no.  No. That is the image, I think we can all agree is very disgusting.  But you know what, Meredith, you lit your hair on fire today.  What about tomorrow.?  What is going to happen when you come into work and you're dead?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I stab her in the brain with a wooden stick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There are several ways to kill a zombie, but the most satisfying one is to stab it in the brain with a wooden stick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everyone in this room loves you, but mark my words, we are not going to support your alcoholism anymore.  The next time you light yourself on fire we are not going to help put you out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, as fire marshal I would have to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: She is a hazard to the other people of the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs]...okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I suppose I could do it if it was a controlled burn in a well ventilated area.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, but you're gonna need a permit for that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh right, that'll take a couple of weeks.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I can get you one in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Okay you know, this-- this is over.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I agree.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, I think... you did the best you could, but this is bigger than all of us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Enabler!  Enabler, enabler, enabler, enabler, enabler.  It's Christmas and we are turning our back on somebody who is asking for help.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what the only thing I want for Christmas? I want Meredith to get better.  That's my only wish.  But you know what?  My wishes never come true, so I'm not going to wish that on her. I-- a watch would be nice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [watching Meredith and Michael talk in his office] They've been in there for 45 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I know.  If she wasn't an alcoholic before, she is now. [Jim laughs]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: That's a halwa shabkia cookie.  They serve it during Ramadan. [Angela spits her cookie out]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Mmmm... chewy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Andy playing the sitar] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you take requests?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Please stop. People are having a Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [whispers to Meredith] I'll be down in a minute. [walks over to Toby] Could you write down the number of that rehabilitation center that you mentioned?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Sure. Wow. [Michael throws a pen at his head] Ow...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: We just missed Poor Richards.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We did?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah, I thought we were going out for a drink?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, shoot.  Oh well, we'll have to go someplace else then I guess.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: The Bog? Cooper's, Kelly's...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We could go there, sure.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: ...Brixx's, Carmen's...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, yes.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: ...The Fort, Andy Gavin's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have a new place.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Well, it must have just opened up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It-- yep, recently.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah... all right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Enough of this Christmas crap.  Let's get some party music. [changes radio station]  Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, oh there you go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's good.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah that's better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We're party girls.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [on phone] Hey Sasha, it's daddy.  Have you ever heard of this doll , Princess Unicorn?

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.line: [shouting excitedly over the phone] Daddy, daddy, daddy!!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No, No, No.  No, I'm just curious if you've heard of it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: This is great.  My ex-wife's going to be so pissed.  [chuckles] For once daddy's gonna be a hero.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yo.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, I'd like to buy one of your dolls.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, that's my last one.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, no, I-- no, no, I was gonna buy that doll.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Thanks man.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I was-- I was gonna get the doll.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not my problem.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: But I-- I promised my daughter. Darryl, look-- I-- I need the doll, I need the doll.  I-- I'm-- I'm begging you.  I just-- I need it more than anything in this world.  I need this doll. Darryl, man I need this doll.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: All right man, don't cry.  It's cool.  I'll let you get it for $400.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I only have $200.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You can owe me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [laughs] Oh man, thanks, thank you, [tearing up] thank you, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I know, right.  Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh thanks.  She's gonna... [notices the doll is black] oh...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Something wrong with the doll?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No.  It's even-- it's even better than the one I wanted.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sunrise Rehab?  No! No! No!  I told you no! There is no way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's okay. It's all right.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No way!  There is no way! No way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Meredith, we are doing this for your own good.  Okay. Come on--

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No way!  No way!  There is no way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here we go. This is gonna be good.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No! No way! I told you. We talked about this.  There is absolutely no way.  No!  No! There is no way!  No! No! I am not going in there! I am not going in there!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes you are. [tries to pull Meredith from the car]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I am not going in there! NO!!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Just wait! Just wait!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shhh... just calm down.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [runs away] Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!  No! No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [chasing Meredith] Come on. Shh...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No! No! No! There is no way! There is no way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here's the door. Here's the door.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: There is no way!  There is no way! No! No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [dragging Meredith on the floor into the rehab center] Let's start meeting-- Hello. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: This man is crazy! This man is crazy!

quotes.speaker: Rehab Nurse
quotes.line: Can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have a deposit.  Alcoholic.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No! No! No! No! No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So do I sign?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: NO!!!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I need you to put the Christmas tree back up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's outside.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I didn't ask you where it was.  I told you where it needs to be.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'm not moving the tree.  Face it. The only power you have over me is this big secret that I know you're not going to tell.  And you want to know how I know that? Because then you won't be able to plan your stupid, tacky parties anymore. So you move the tree.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Okay. [starts to walk away, then turns around] Angela's having sex with Dwight.  I caught them doing it after Toby's going away party.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well don't look so surprised.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I knew it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You did not know it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I knew some of it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Everyone knew some of it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You knew it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thank you. I knew it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She knew it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: As it turns out you can't just check someone into rehab against their will.  They have to do it voluntarily.  They have to hit rock bottom.  So I think I know what I need to do at this point.  I need to find ways to push Meredith to the bottom.  Um... I think I can do it.  I did it with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: All right, everybody's still here.  Perfect! Got a little surprise I've been working on.  Angela, my bride, I just wanted you to know that for the rest of our lives, no matter the cultural milieu, I will always be there to bring you Christmas cheer.  [sings] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la.  Tis the season to be jolly. Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la.  Don we now our gay apparel. Fa-la-la-la-la-LA.  Troll the little Yule tide carol. Roo-di-di-di-do. Roododododo. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I think I'd like to go home now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Sure. Dooo. Tough room. [chuckles] Come on. I just learned it.  Just so you know protocol is a little round of applause. But, Merry Christmas to all, and to all a good night.
